trans-unit.source: Encapsulates the information used to render a list control that repeats a list of items.
This class cannot be inherited.

The RepeatInfo class encapsulates the information used to render a list control that repeats a list of items, such as <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBoxList>, <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataList>, and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RadioButtonList>.
It is primarily used by control developers.
For a list of initial property values for an instance of RepeatInfo, see the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RepeatInfo.%23ctor%2A> constructor.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.RepeatInfo"></xref> class.
Use this constructor to create and initialize a new instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RepeatInfo> class using default values.
The following table shows initial property values for an instance of <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RepeatInfo>.

|Property|Initial Value| |--------------|-------------------| |OuterTableImplied|`false`| |RepeatColumns|`0`| |RepeatDirection|<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RepeatDirection>| |RepeatLayout|<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RepeatLayout>|
Gets or sets the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Table.Caption*> property if the control is rendered as a <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Table"></xref>.
A string that specifies the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Table"></xref> caption.
Gets or sets the alignment of the caption, if the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.RepeatInfo"></xref> is rendered as a <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Table"></xref>.
This property sets the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Table.CaptionAlign%2A> property of the rendered <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Table>.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableCaptionAlign"></xref> value for the rendered table.
The default value is <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableCaptionAlign"></xref>.
The selected value is not one of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableCaptionAlign"></xref> values.
Gets or sets a value indicating whether items should be rendered as if they are contained in a table.
Use the OuterTableImplied property to specify whether items should be rendered as if they are contained in a table.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the items should be rendered as if they are contained in a table; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Renders a list control that repeats a list of items, using the specified information.
Use the RenderRepeater method to render a list control that repeats a list of items, using the specified information.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter"></xref> that represents the output stream used to render HTML content on the client.
An <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.IRepeatInfoUser"></xref> implemented object that represents the control to render.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style"></xref> that represents the style in which to display the items.
The control from which to copy base attributes.
Gets or sets the number of columns to render.
Use the RepeatColumns property to specify the number of columns to render in the control.
The number of columns to render.
Gets or sets a value that specifies whether the items are displayed vertically or horizontally.
Use the RepeatDirection property to specify the direction that the items are rendered.
> [!NOTE] > The number of columns displayed is always determined by the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RepeatInfo.RepeatColumns%2A> property.
If this property is set to `RepeatDirection.Vertical`, the items in the list are displayed in columns loaded top to bottom, then left to right, until all items are rendered.
For example, if the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RepeatInfo.RepeatColumns%2A> property is set to `3`, the items are displayed in three columns, as in the following table.

|||| |-|-|-| |1|4|7| |2|5|8| |3|6|9| If this property is set to `RepeatDirection.Horizontal`, the items in the list are displayed in rows loaded left to right, then top to bottom, until all items are rendered.
For example, if the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RepeatInfo.RepeatColumns%2A> property is set to `3`, the items are displayed in rows of three items each, as in the following table.
One of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.RepeatDirection"></xref> enumeration values.
The specified direction is not one of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.RepeatDirection"></xref> enumeration values.
Gets or sets a value specifying whether items are displayed in a table.
Use the RepeatLayout property to specify whether the items are displayed in a table.
If this property is set to <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RepeatLayout>, the items in the list are displayed in a table.
If this property is set to <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RepeatLayout>, the items in the list are displayed without a table structure.
One of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.RepeatLayout"></xref> enumeration values.
The specified layout is not one of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.RepeatLayout"></xref> enumeration values.

Gets or sets a value to indicate whether to add a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableHeaderCell.Scope*> attribute when the control is rendered as a <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Table"></xref>.

If `true` and the control is rendered as a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Table>, a "scope" attribute with value "col" is added and a table header cell (\<th>) is rendered instead of a table cell (\<td>) for the header cells when the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Table> is rendered.
This attribute can be used by screen readers.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if a "scope" attribute is to be added, otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
